Inverse Function: Let <math display="inline">f : A \to B</math> be a function. The inverse of <math display="inline">f</math> is another function, written: <math display="block">f^{-1} : B \to A</math> defined by

<math display="block">\forall x \in A, \forall y \in B, x = f^{-1}\left(y\right) \Leftrightarrow y = f\left(x\right)</math>

Assuming that <math display="inline">f^{-1}</math> is a function.

The following is an equivalent definition <math display="block">\begin{cases}
    \forall x \in A, & f^{-1}\left(f\left(x\right)\right)=x\\
    \forall y \in B, & f\left(f^{-1}\left(y\right)\right)=y
  \end{cases}</math>
